channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: K-pop boy band Stray Kids' album 'Karma' debuts at the top of the Billboards
item.description: KPop Demon Hunters is still doing great on the Billboard charts. But another K-pop juggernaut debuts in the top spot for albums. That'd be the boy band Stray Kids, whose new album is titled Karma.

item.title: Maine residents hold a party to toast with their future neighbors... at the cemetery
item.description: In Weld, Maine, anyone who owns a plot at the Mountain View Cemetery is invited to a yearly gathering at the undertaker's home -- a chance to "get to know who you'll spend eternity with," locals say.

item.title: This week in science: Recycling innovation, scrolling dangers and the inside of Mars
item.description: NPR's Emily Kwong and Regina Barber of Short Wave talk about an innovation in plastic recycling, the link between smartphones and hemorrhoids and what Mars' structure and ice cream have in common.

item.title: States prepare alternative COVID vaccine plans to maintain access
item.description: States vary in their policies for COVID vaccines this fall, which could affect availability and put many at odds with the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.

item.title: The U.S. government is taking a stake in Intel. It's rare â€” but not unprecedented
item.description: The Trump administration last month took a 10% stake in chipmaker Intel. It's not the first time the government has taken a stake in a U.S. firm, but the circumstances are unusual and the desired outcome -- renewed American prowess in chipmaking -- is far from guaranteed.

item.title: A single dose of LSD can treat anxiety and depression for months, study shows
item.description: A new study finds that a single dose of LSD can ease a person's anxiety for months. This could give legitimacy to research on a range of psychedelics.

item.title: Missouri lawmakers meet to redraw congressional districts at the urging of Trump
item.description: Missouri lawmakers meet to redraw their congressional districts so they're more favorable to Republican congressional candidates. It comes at the urging of President Trump.

item.title: The dangers of a Powerball office pool
item.description: An individual person's odds of winning the lottery are slim, so an office pool can be a way to improve your odds. But how do you avoid the pitfalls of the office lottery pool?

item.title: How New Zealand wildlife sanctuaries are working to protect the country's unique birds
item.description: New Zealand has some of the most unique birds in the world. Many are endangered, so the country has a nationwide project to save them. It's trying to eradicate invasive animals that are harming them.

item.title: Former staffers of Climate.gov are attempting to launch a new site: Climate.us
item.description: Climate.gov went dark after cuts from the Trump administration. Now, a group of former employees are trying to revive it under a new domain.
